refnamediv.refpurpose: A container of channels organizing them as input or output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AgsAudio organizes AgsChannel objects either as input or output and is responsible of their alignment. The class can contain AgsRecall objects in order to perform computation on all channels or in audio context. Therefor exists AgsRecyclingContext acting as tree context.
At least one AgsRecallID is assigned to it and has one more if AGS_AUDIO_OUTPUT_HAS_RECYCLING is set as flag.
If AGS_AUDIO_HAS_NOTATION is set as flag one AgsNotation is allocated per audio channel.

refsect2.title: ags_audio_set_audio_channels ()
refsect2.para: Resize audio channels AgsInput will be allocated first.

refsect2.title: ags_audio_set_pads ()
refsect2.programlisting: void ags_audio_set_pads (AgsAudio *audio, GType type, guint pads);
refsect2.para: Sets pad count for the apropriate type

refsect2.title: ags_audio_init_run ()
refsect2.para: Is emitted as audio is initialized.

refsect2.title: ags_audio_tact ()
refsect2.para: Is emitted as audio is played.

refsect2.title: ags_audio_done ()
refsect2.para: Is emitted as playing audio is done.

refsect2.title: ags_audio_set_soundcard ()
refsect2.para: Sets a soundcard object on audio.

refsect2.title: ags_audio_duplicate_recall ()
refsect2.para: Duplicate all AgsRecall templates of this AgsAudio.

entry.para: stage benning at 0 up to 2, or just -1
the AgsRecallID to use or NULL

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if it's playing otherwise FALSE

refsect2.title: ags_audio_play ()
refsect2.para: Performs on single play call of appropriate stage.

entry.para: valid range is from 0 up to 2

refsect2.title: ags_audio_recursive_play_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: GList * ags_audio_recursive_play_init (AgsAudio *audio, gboolean playback, gboolean sequencer, gboolean notation);
refsect2.para: Initializes AgsAudio in order to do playback, sequencer or notation.

refsect2.title: ags_audio_open_files ()
refsect2.programlisting: void ags_audio_open_files (AgsAudio *audio, GSList *filenames, gboolean overwrite_channels, gboolean create_channels);

entry.para: if existing channels should be assigned
if new channels should be created as not fitting if combined with overwrite_channels

refsect2.title: ags_audio_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates an AgsAudio, with defaults of soundcard .

refsect2.title: The play property
refsect2.para: The AgsRecall it contains in play-context.

refsect2.title: The recall property
refsect2.para: The AgsRecall it contains in recall-context.

refsect2.title: The recall-container property
refsect2.para: The AgsRecallContainer it contains in container-context.

refsect2.title: The soundcard property
refsect2.para: The assigned AgsSoundcard acting as default sink.

refsect2.title: The done signal
refsect2.para: The ::done signal is invoked while terminating playback of audio .

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The init-run signal
refsect2.para: The ::init-run signal is invoked during dynamic initialization of recalls of audio .

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The set-audio-channels signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AgsAudio *audio, guint audio_channels_new, guint audio_channels_old, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: The ::set-audio-channels signal notifies about changes in channel alignment.

entry.para: the object to adjust the channels.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The set-pads signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AgsAudio *audio, gulong type, guint pads_new, guint pads_old, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: The ::set-pads signal notifies about changes in channel alignment.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The tact signal
refsect2.para: The ::tact signal is invoked during playback of recalls of audio .

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
